org.contentmine.graphics.svg.fonts

Class Typeface

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.contentmine.graphics.svg.fonts.Typeface
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Typeface>

    public class Typeface
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Typeface>
    a typeface. "font" is often confused with "typeface". Here we try to separate typefaces within a StyleRecordSet. All styles with the same FontName belong to one TypeFace (i.e. ignore sizes, styles, weight, stroke, etc) Where possible the Bold, Italic qualifiers will be mapped onto a single font. So Helvetica (any size, weight, style, stroke) maps to Helvetica HelveticaBold, HelveticaOblique, etc map to Helvetica HelevticaNarrow is a different TypeFace This is empirical. Currently it tries to manage change of style and weight to allow and tags
    Author:
    pm286
